title: Developments in Mobile Scanning Technology: Understanding the Potential Impact on Shrinkage & Loss Prevention.
abstractText:
Technological innovation in retailing is evolving at a pace including developments in online shopping and the roll out of customer ‘self-scan’ checkouts across many stores. While these developments are designed to help expand markets and increase customer convenience, they also potentially increase vulnerabilities to crime. Although customer ‘self-scan’ is now a common feature of the retail landscape, many large retailers are also experimenting with mobile scanning and purchase payment utilising devices owned by the customer.

The roll-out of mobile scanning raises questions about how this technology can be introduced in a way that does not increase opportunity for crime/shrinkage and also how the retail space might need to be adapted to achieve this. By working in partnership with three major retailers, this research aims to:

  • explore issues around the implementation of mobile scanning technologies
  • establish the potential impact of such technologies upon loss/shrinkage
  • understand the impact of mobile scanning on the use of existing product protection technologies 
  • how this might lead to the development of new product protection approaches.

Ultimately, the project will consider whether this type of technology will require a new generation of crime prevention thinking within the retail environment.
